articles.description: Latest football news, including reaction to Thursday's Europa and Conference League ties and build-up to the weekend's FA Cup & Premier League action.
articles.title: European reaction, quarter-final draws & Premier League build-up

articles.description: George Martin has won 10 Test caps and is still in the relative infancy of his international career, but his performances for England have belied his 22 years.
articles.title: England's enforcer Martin set to lead the way in 'Le Crunch'

articles.description: Liverpool thrash Sparta Prague at Anfield to complete a resounding aggregate victory as they move into the quarter-finals of the Europa League.
articles.title: Liverpool thrash Sparta to reach last eight

articles.description: Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner extends his winning run to 19 matches before a bee swarm holds up Carlos Alcaraz at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Jannik Sinner extends winning run as bee swarm halts Carlos Alcaraz match

articles.description: Aston Villa captain John McGinn wants more memorable European nights after helping the club into the quarter-finals of the Europa Conference League.
articles.title: 'We want to achieve more' - Villa enjoy night 'to remember'

articles.description: Banned Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva was given 56 medications, nutritional and dietary supplements, the Court of Arbitration for Sport reveals.
articles.title: Kamila Valieva: Russian figure skater given 56 medications and supplements over two years

articles.description: World number two Carlos Alcaraz shares his thoughts after a swarm of bees descends on his match with Alexander Zverev at Indian Wells.
articles.title: 'I'm a bit afraid of them!' - Alcaraz on bee invasion

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Anna Friedberg and Emily Linden from alt-rock band Friedberg to make predictions for this weekend's FA Cup quarter-final ties and Premier League games.
articles.title: Sutton's FA Cup & Premier League predictions v alt-rock band Friedberg

articles.description: Rangers manager Philippe Clement was full of praise for his "brave" players after Europa League defeat by Benfica, but admitted they did not make the most of key moments.
articles.title: 'Brave' Rangers fall short but 'hungry' for success

articles.description: Galopin Des Champs bids to defend the Cheltenham Gold Cup on Friday for record-breaking trainer Willie Mullins as the big race marks its 100th anniversary.
articles.title: Cheltenham Gold Cup: Galopin Des Champs, Fastorslow, Corach Rambler among runners
